intro: Erigeron glabratus subsp. glabratus, commonly known as the roughleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields, and it thrives in full sun. Its leaves are generally rough to the touch, giving it its common name, while its flowers are often pale blue to white in color. It is an annual plant that produces seeds that are dispersed by wind, contributing to its widespread distribution.
